Authors:
Juan Mart√≠n Suarez, Alexandra M. Gottlieb, Bernardo E.
Lechner
Title: A new and intriguing brown-spored Leucocoprinus species
Abstract:
Leucocoprinus brunneosporus sp. nov., collected at the
Santa Catalina Reserve (Buenos Aires, Argentina), is proposed as a new
species. We performed separate phylogenetic analyses of the nuclear rDNA
large subunit (28S) region and the complete nuclear rDNA internal
transcribed spacer region (ITS) to establish the placement of the new
species in the phylogeny of the Agaricaceae. This new species has a
macromorphology similar to that of Lc. birnbaumii, but the spore print
is light brown. Detailed descriptions and illustrations of the macro-
and microscopic characters are provided.
